blog.name: mandalawritersmart
blog.title: Reimagine!
blog.description: Promoting Positivity through your favorite characters!

title: The Secret of Grass (Type)
body:
Greninja:(raising his hand) I have a question.
Kirby:Yes, Greninja?
Greninja:(prideful)In the movie, can we have a fight scene between me and Ivysaur?
Kirby:(confused)Uh...
Ivysaur:For the last time, Greninja, I don’t want to fight you!
Greninja:But I have too! I need to know your secrets of your strengths! (Grabs Ivysaur) And you will tell me! What’s the secret?
Ash:(unamused)Maybe it’s the fact that he’s a grass type, and the water types are weak against it.
Greninja:(tapping his chin)Okay, that makes sense, but what about those two? (Points at Squirtle and Charizard)
Ivysaur:(not amused as well) What about them?
Greninja:So far, they’re the worst I ever fought.
Squirtle:(offended)Squirtle!
(Charizard roars in anger)
Greninja:Plus, you’re with them, so how is it you’re with a bunch of newbies?
Ivysaur:(annoyed)They are not newbies. Charizard is a fire type, which makes him weak against you, and Squirtle is just like you!
Greninja:Ah, but you didn’t take into account that I saw you fighting with the humans. You’ve been training illegally!
Ivysaur:(😡)That’s because this is Sm5sh, not Pokemon!
Kirby:(nervous)Okay, let’s move on!
(LOL. Just thought of this while playing sm5sh.)

summary: Detective Pikachu Walks into a Precinct
body:
Detective Pikachu Walks into a Precinct

A random officer bursts out of an interrogation room: “What is that? Is that a Pikachu?! Is he wearing a tiny hat?! IS THAT A PIKACHU WEARING A TINY HAT?!”

*punches a desk through a desk

“HES GOT A TINY HAT! YAGAGAWAGAGWAGAGA! HE’S GOT A TINY HAAAAAAT!”

After giving them highly classified documents in exchange for a hug and a photo, he returns home to his own pichu and gives it a tiny hat, and he can’t control his sobbing

summary: You know, maybe it was a smart move to have Detective Pikachu come out 2 weeks after Avengers Endgame. No doubt that movie’s...
body: You know, maybe it was a smart move to have Detective Pikachu come out 2 weeks after Avengers Endgame. No doubt that movie’s going to leave a lot of people really emotional and heartbroken coming out of it, so a lighthearted and fun movie about a talking Pikachu solving mysteries would probably be exactly the pick-me-up a lot of people are going to be needing around that time. It’ll make a killing on it’s opening weekend.

reblog.comment: You know, maybe it was a smart move to have Detective Pikachu come out 2 weeks after Avengers Endgame. No doubt that movie’s going to leave a lot of people really emotional and heartbroken coming out of it, so a lighthearted and fun movie about a talking Pikachu solving mysteries would probably be exactly the pick-me-up a lot of people are going to be needing around that time. It’ll make a killing on it’s opening weekend.

No doubt that movie’s going to leave a lot of people really emotional and heartbroken coming out of it, so a lighthearted and fun movie about a talking Pikachu solving mysteries would probably be exactly the pick-me-up a lot of people are going to be needing around that time. It’ll make a killing on it’s opening weekend.

No doubt that movie’s going to leave a lot of people really emotional and heartbroken coming out of it, so a lighthearted and fun movie about a talking Pikachu solving mysteries would probably be exactly the pick-me-up a lot of people are going to be needing around that time. It’ll make a killing on it’s opening weekend.

summary: I think it needs to be acknowledged that if Detective Pikachu comes out and it’s both really good and a big hit with audiences,...
body:
I think it needs to be acknowledged that if Detective Pikachu comes out and it’s both really good and a big hit with audiences, then the movie is going to be a franchise changing event. 

Warner Bros already have a sequel in the works, and there have been rumours for weeks now that they want to do spin-off films, so this could easily spawn into a big multi-movie series. It’ll probably bring in a good number of new fans and people who don’t normally play Pokémon, and make a lot more money than any of the animated films ever have.

It’s possible that these films could become the face of the franchise in the eyes of much of the public, or at least the younger generation of fans only just getting into Pokémon, in the same way the anime was back during the Pokémon boom of the 90′s/early 2000′s. We’ll probably be seeing more references to DP and probably other movies in the games, we might get a sequel game to Detective Pikachu to promote the sequel or something.

When people look back on the franchises history in about 10-20 years, pre-Detective Pikachu and Post-Detective Pikachu could very well be the lens through which a lot of people look at it.

Between this and a lot of other big developments for both the games and the anime this year, this year we’re probably looking at the start of a whole new era in the Pokémon franchises history. And I’m very curious to see what that era will be like

Warner Bros already have a sequel in the works, and there have been rumours for weeks now that they want to do spin-off films, so this could easily spawn into a big multi-movie series. It’ll probably bring in a good number of new fans and people who don’t normally play Pokémon, and make a lot more money than any of the animated films ever have.

It’s possible that these films could become the face of the franchise in the eyes of much of the public, or at least the younger generation of fans only just getting into Pokémon, in the same way the anime was back during the Pokémon boom of the 90′s/early 2000′s. trail.content:
I think it needs to be acknowledged that if Detective Pikachu comes out and it’s both really good and a big hit with audiences, then the movie is going to be a franchise changing event. 

Warner Bros already have a sequel in the works, and there have been rumours for weeks now that they want to do spin-off films, so this could easily spawn into a big multi-movie series. It’ll probably bring in a good number of new fans and people who don’t normally play Pokémon, and make a lot more money than any of the animated films ever have.

It’s possible that these films could become the face of the franchise in the eyes of much of the public, or at least the younger generation of fans only just getting into Pokémon, in the same way the anime was back during the Pokémon boom of the 90′s/early 2000′s. We’ll probably be seeing more references to DP and probably other movies in the games, we might get a sequel game to Detective Pikachu to promote the sequel or something.

When people look back on the franchises history in about 10-20 years, pre-Detective Pikachu and Post-Detective Pikachu could very well be the lens through which a lot of people look at it.

Between this and a lot of other big developments for both the games and the anime this year, this year we’re probably looking at the start of a whole new era in the Pokémon franchises history. And I’m very curious to see what that era will be like

summary: Sonic the Hedgehog Movie Writer set for Detective Pikachu 2
title: Sonic the Hedgehog Movie Writer set for Detective Pikachu 2
body:
Sonic the Hedgehog Movie Writer set for Detective Pikachu 2

Although Detective Pikachu hasn’t been released yet, Warner Bros and Legendary Pictures are so confident that it will be a success they already started planning for a sequel.

It has been announced Sonic the Hedgehog movie screenwriter Oren Uziel will join the project. Uziel’s other credited projects include Netflix’s The Cloverfield Paradox.

Detective Pikachuis a upcoming film based on the…

summary: I feel bad for the people who's favorite Pokémon is legit Pikachu, like they're emotionally connected to the yellow fucker, but...

trail.content_raw: I feel bad for the people who’s favorite Pokémon is legit Pikachu, like they’re emotionally connected to the yellow fucker, but are constantly titled as “Fake Fans” to a lot of the Pokémon community.
trail.content: I feel bad for the people who’s favorite Pokémon is legit Pikachu, like they’re emotionally connected to the yellow fucker, but are constantly titled as “Fake Fans” to a lot of the Pokémon community.
